intro: Alangium faberi var. dolichocarpum, commonly known as the long-seeded alangium, is a deciduous shrub native to southern China. It belongs to the family Berberidaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant produces small, elongated fruits that contain multiple seeds. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in forested areas. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
